alert.note: Alert for Modoc County Except for the Surprise Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 25 at 1:50AM PDT until September 25 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND AND LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 285, 624, AND 625... * IMPACTS...Any new or ongoing fires will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended. * AFFECTED AREA...In CAZ285...eastern portions of Fire weather zone 285. In ORZ624...the southeastern portion of Fire weather zone 624, including the Morgan Fire. In ORZ625...much of Fire weather zone 625 south of Silver Lake. * WIND...South to southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts 35 to 45 mph.Gusts up to 55 mph are likely across the higher terrain. * HUMIDITY...10% to 15%. * DETAILED URL...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Avoid tossing burning cigarettes on the ground, parking hot vehicles on dry vegetation, and using equipment that can cause sparks. Follow all fire restrictions. Find links to restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire. Gather your fire evacuation kit and familiarize yourself with your evacuation plan. Collect essentials you don`t want to lose and prioritize your checklist. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. These conditions promote rapid spread of fire which may become life threatening. Evacuate if ordered to, or if a fire threatens.

area.areaDesc: Modoc County Except for the Surprise Valley
